title: How Many Calories in a Piece of Pizza?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a piece of pizza, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for cheese or pepperoni slices.
h1: How Many Calories in a Piece of Pizza?
assumptions: Standard 1/8 slice of 14-inch cheese pizza; thin crust, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese; baked, no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, crust type, toppings, brand, and preparation. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheese pizza contains about 285 calories and 12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use thin crust instead of regular

faqs.q: How many calories in a piece of cheese pizza?
faqs.a: About 285 kcal for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one slice of pizza?
faqs.a: Roughly 36 g carbs, including 2 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does pizza have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 640 mg per slice from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How do toppings affect calories in pizza?
faqs.a: Meats like pepperoni add 50+ kcal; veggies add fewer.

faqs.q: Is deep-dish pizza higher in calories?
faqs.a: Yes, often 400+ kcal per slice due to thicker crust.
